intro: Triguera inodora, commonly known as the odorless triguera, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Triguera inodora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
